headline: Another Industry Destroyed by Taxes
author: John Hinderaker
sentences: The cannabis industry in California is on the brink of collapse because of high taxes and onerous regulations that have burdened legal operators and allowed illegal growers to flourish, campaigners have warned.
They blame taxes, too much regulation and a failure to tackle illegal competition, which is free from red tape and able to offer cannabis at much lower prices.
But I have mixed feelings about this one: California cannabis industry on brink as buyers return to dealers.
*** About 75 per cent of cannabis consumed in the state comes from illegal sources, industry figures say.
How many industries have been damaged or destroyed by high taxes and excessive regulation?
